title: My tip sheet
text:
Creating a project
When creating a project in R studio you want to:

Choose file, make a new project
Click “New Directory”, then “Quarto Blog” for project type.
Make a folder, give it a name with no spaces. Be aware that “Create a git repository” is clicked.
Click on “Create project”

Write your own post

title: QMD post
text:
Be able to make a new .qmd document: Yes
Be able to render a .qmd document: Yes
Explain the difference between the source editor view and visual editor view in Rstudio: Visual editor lets you edit/view the text how it would appear in the website.
Be able to insert simple markdown plain text (headers, lists, paragraphs), and render the document: Yes
Be aware of resources to help you learn more about markdown options. Yes
Be able to insert an R code chunk, and show the output in the rendered document.


macro for quick insert


Running R code chunks in a qmd


pressing play
copy/paste into console
highlight then command-enter (mac)
precedence issues (first to last)


Be aware of R code chunk options, and how to use eval, messages, error, warning, and echo.
Be able to set code chunk options per chunk, and/or for the whole document. Understand rules for precedence (which options will apply if both are set.)
Write inline r code.
Explain how the rendering environment is different from the Rstudio environment.
Be aware of more advanced quarto options for html documents, and try some of the options.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome! I’m gonna try to add an image of my own!



Let’s hope this works!


Success!!
